thread.title: Robbie Gould wins NFC Special Teams Player of the Week
thread.title_full: Robbie Gould wins NFC Special Teams Player of the Week | Chicago Sun-Times

author: | emailAddress.indexOf('@') == -1) {errorString = 'Please enter your email address';} var isError = false; if (errorString.length > 0) isError = true; if (isError) alert(errorString); return !isError;}
title: Robbie Gould wins NFC Special Teams Player of the Week
text:
There was no player as vital to the Bears 22-20 victory over the Oakland Raiders than kicker Robbie Gould. He hit three field goals, including a game-winner with seconds remaining, in Chicago’s first win of the season.
My reaction after @RobbieGould09 FG. Don't make fun of the TV. #Bears #BearDown @CLTVSportsFeed pic.twitter.com/vwDQTY16jf
— Jarrett W. Payton (@paytonsun) October 4, 2015
For his efforts, Gould has been named the NFC Special Teams Player of the Week.
With FGs of 19, 54 and 49 yds, @RobbieGould09 earns NFC Special Teams Player of the Week honors.
Congrats, Robbie! pic.twitter.com/2qgYKIGSTl
— Chicago Bears (@ChicagoBears) October 7, 2015
He now has three career Special Teams Player of the Week awards and has connected on 12 game-winning field goals, per ESPN. Gould is also the Bears’ record holder for career field goals made (252).
He needs only five points to surpass Kevin Butler (1,116) and become the Bears’ all-time leading scorer.
Chicago’s special teams haven’t looked great in most spots this season, but when Gould’s kicking it usually bodes well.
